meanings.definition: Excessive admiration or worship of books.
meanings.sent1: Her bibliolatries were evident in the way she treated her book collection with utmost care.
meanings.sent2: The library was a place of bibliolatries, where every book was cherished and revered.
meanings.sent3: His bibliolatries reached new heights when he started bowing to his favorite novels before reading them.
meanings.sent4: In the world of bibliolatries, books were seen as sacred objects deserving of reverence.
meanings.sent5: The bibliolatries of the book club members knew no bounds, as they discussed their favorite reads with passion.

meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe's bibliolatries involved rituals where books were placed on pedestals and adorned with flowers.
meanings.sent2: In the temple of bibliolatries, the sacred texts were treated with the utmost respect and devotion.
meanings.sent3: The bibliolatries of the bookworm were so intense that they built a shrine for their favorite novels.
meanings.sent4: The bibliolatries of the scholar were akin to a religious fervor, with each book considered a holy scripture.
meanings.sent5: The bibliolatries of the bibliophile were so profound that they spent hours caressing the covers of their most treasured books.
